questions.question: What is the definition for aerobic endurance?

choices.answer: Quickness of an athlete to run a certain distance
Maximum force a muscle can produce
Ability of the heart and lungs to work without tiring.
The amount of times the heart beats during exercise
Maximum force a muscle can produce
Range of movement at a joint/joints
The result of speed and strength
Ability of muscles to work without tiring.

choices.answer: Vertical Jump Test
Bleep Test
35m Sprint Test
Multi-Stage Fitness Test
Involves intense exercise e.g. sprints, followed by rest.
Jumping up and down for a ling period of time
Doing something continuously, varying intensity.
Involves training over a long distance at a steady pace.
The result of speed and strength
Maximum force that can be produced
Range of movement at a joint/joints
The ability to change direction quickly at speed
Grip Strength Dynamometer Test
Multi-stage fitness test
Sprint Test
Vertical Jump Test
Maintaining a centre of mass over base of support
Strength and speed
Range of movement in joints of the body
Being able to do the splits
Alternate Hand Wall Toss Test
Sit and Reach Test
Standing Stork Test
Bleep Test
Intensive bouts of exercise over time followed by rest
Performing exercises in a set order, called stations.
Using weights to develop strength
Training for a period of time at a steady pace, e,g, running

questions.question: What is the definition of balance?

choices.answer: Something you need to be a gymnast
Standing still without falling over
Ability to maintain centre of mass over base of support
Ability to maintain base of support over centre of mass

questions.question: What sport would need high levels of aerobic endurance?

choices.answer: Long jump
Sprinting
Darts
Long distance running
The time it takes to get from one place to another
The ability to cover a set distance quickly
The ability to change direction slowly at speed
The ability to change direction quickly at speed

choices.answer: Sit and Reach Test
1 Minute Press Up Test
1 Minute Sit up Test
Vertical Jump Test
Minimum force a muscle can produce against a resistance
The combination of speed and strength
The ability of muscles to work over a period of time
Maximum force a muscle can produce against a resistance
Bicep Curl Test
Pull Up Test
Arm Strength Dynamometer Test
Grip Strength Dynamometer Test
Running as quickly as possible over a set distance
Running at a steady pace for a set time
Intense bouts of exercise followed by periods of rest
Varied pace e.g. walking, jogging, running, sprinting

choices.answer: Power
Aerobic endurance
Muscular endurance

questions.question: What is the definition of speed?

choices.answer: The combination of speed and strength
Maximum force that can be produced
Quickness of an athlete to cover a certain distance.
Running at a steady pace for a set time.
